text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for an album really related
whatever album review Loma Prieta I V
these guys are a California band fourth
full-length album and the this group has
undergone quite a bit of change to be
playing with the sound that they
currently are no matter which loma album
you're talking about the band's heart
has always been pretty sentimental
towards screamo and hardcore punk and
now more than ever this bands take on
screamo music is extremely raw and
uncompromising coming off as intense and
passionate as some of the best albums in
this genre created by bands like let's
say page 99 who represent really the
more extreme side of things
now this bands early work was intense as
well but definitely more accessible the
group's first two lp's definitely had
much more clarity to them clearer guitar
chords maybe some clean singing - I was
even catching some vocal harmonies on
the second LP I guess overall with those
albums there was a clearer balance
between the abrasive sounds and the
pleasant sounds but as the band
progressed past those two LPs
they've just been getting harsher and
harsher and now on this album right here
I think they're performing tracks with
their harshest sound yet it is very very
nasty and these guys accomplished this
nasty goal by blending screamo and poor
Punk with with other styles of music
like noise there are some spots on here
that kind of hit me as being sort of
very powerful ensuite
very punked-out riffs and blast beats
and some of the riffs on here just feel
really sludgy really thick and powering
some tastefully performed breakdowns
but even with all these extreme sounds
all of this discord these guys still
managed to find a way to put just some
gorgeous musical ideas into these tracks
the opening track here starts off with
these pounding headache pounding drums
and these screams the way that dude the
frontman in this group screams by the
end of this album er just maybe at the
end of a show his voice his vocal cords
have got to be feeling like he swallowed
a bunch of ghost chilies or like some
molten lava or something his vocals just
are so heavy with these painful emotions
and the vocals together with the bass
the guitar and the drums they're all so
loud together and packed so tightly into
this small sonic space it's kind of
claustrophobic the music is right on top
of me and there's just no getting away
this album can be just as harsh at times
as some of the most lo-fi black metal
albums out there or even like a converge
album toward the middle of this opening
track there is kind of this quiet break
and then the song busts into these
really kind of harmonious guitar chords
they're really triumphant they're really
beautiful they're still played at an
ear-shattering volume but I love how
pretty these guitar chords are and how
they finish off this track with a kind
of positive note and that's kind of
where this LP finds its success just
violently smashing together ugly and and
beauty without even worrying about the
consequences and then just kind of
counting the casualties after that I
think the next two tracks are some of
the most unforgiving on this album a bit
of a blur for me but they're still
thrilling enough to carry me to the next
three tracks which are kind of a trilogy
some blast beats make their way onto
these tracks just shots of feedback and
these really kind of paranoia powered
guitar leads
but my favorite in this trilogy has got
to be the final track it has to be the
hardest and harshest track on this LP
the riffs are as deadly as the Death
Star and when this band flows into the
breakdown toward the end of this song
they really kind of groove it out they
let it play out and as they're playing
it the production the recording just
starts getting louder just more
saturated more distorted and it
continues in this direction until it
basically becomes a wall of almost
complete noise it's almost like the
music is so extreme it's just
disintegrating before my ears it's just
a real show of just spiteful bleak
nihilistic feelings now funny enough
after this track all the songs start
showcasing a lot more harmony in the
guitars in the guitars at least that's
what I'm kind of picking up but the
guitar chords just start feeling much
more mournful much darker and it really
kind of takes the aggression that the
band has been building up to this point
and starts mixing all this sadness into
it all of a sudden clenched fists look
teary eyes the eighth track uniform has
some really anthemic chords and for lack
of a better word catchy vocals the track
after that has a really kind of forceful
driving rhythm that I love and the track
after that aside from this distant
chatter there is nothing left one of my
favorites on this LP actually is a song
in three I love it when a band can play
with a really extreme sound but still
rock a tune in three timing and the way
they break the rhythm up in that time
signature with this track is really kind
of unexpected kind of progressive on the
second-to-last track there are these
breaks of clean guitar chords that are
kind of dark just shining out and the
final song here is is loud but it's much
slower and kind of feels like the quiet
after this really intense storm just
this wasteland is left after all of
these extremely tortured
and just voluminous screamo songs at
this point I have heard 12 tracks and
they've just flown by in 24 minutes you
know I think aggressive music is is
great no matter what genre you're making
it in because let's face it aggression
is not limited to this kind of music but
if you can mix aggression with other
feelings and emotions creatively almost
in a way where it's kind of seamless
you're going to end up with a more
interesting album you're going to end up
with an album with a more powerful
emotional impact you're going to end up
with an album that appeals to people on
more emotional levels aside from writing
fantastic songs that's what I feel like
this album does that is the core of this
LP for me raw unadulterated sadness but
that sadness is is put together with
this anger that sometimes makes this
album alienating ly harsh it's not like
the music here is switching sides
between being pretty being lab being
pretty being loud it mixes them both
together at the same time forming them
to just coexist I know I love this but
still the volume and the abrasiveness of
this album does make me wonder if other
people will follow me on this one kind
of feeling a strong eight to a light
nine on this helpI it was a great listen
and can't wait to listen to it more in
the very near future but what do you
guys think of this LP love it hate it
why and what should I review next
anthony Fantana Loma Prieta forever
[Music]
